Brunno Silva wrote:
>   Well, I worked a litlle with the J2MEUnit, it resolved my problems, 
> but i'm still working in some other questions about. Meanwhile, I'd 
> like to talk with you about Java 3D. I'm trying to make a little 
> exploration in sensorial capacity, but how to test it? Do I need to 
> make a Java 3D application inside the test or is there a more elegant 
> solution?
You'll have to fill me in on what you mean by "sensorial capacity".  I 
have some experience with Java3D.  The approach that worked the best is 
similar to what UI people call "Humble Dialog": try to keep the actual 
rendering isolated to a very thin layer on top of a rich model.  This 
way, you can test the colors, positions, and relationships of objects 
without even referencing the Java3D API.  You may be able to get the 
rendering layer so thin that you can trust it after manual inspection 
and user testing, or you may need to use some other acceptance testing 
technique.  Good luck,

    David Saff
